Using corresponding angles to show two lines are parallel - Free Math tutorial

\begin{array}{l}\n\frac{0}{0} \\\n\frac{1}{1} \\\n1 \times-2 \\\n10-3 \times 1= \\\n10 \\\n1\n\end{array}[imath]\frac{0}{0} [/imath] [imath]\frac{1}{1} [/imath] [imath]1 \times-2 [/imath] [imath]10-3 \times 1= [/imath] [imath]10 [/imath] [imath]1[/imath]
